title: Director, Omnichannel Media Analytics
description:

Spring & Bond is a digital media agency and consultancy specializing in helping pharmaceutical and medical device manufacturers create robust, omnichannel media strategies for both healthcare professionals (HCPs) and consumer audiences. We emphasize transparency and client empowerment through comprehensive services, including customer journey planning, media strategy and activation, technology evaluation, in-house capability development, and training.

What you’ll do:

We are looking for a Director, Omnichannel Media Analytics to help lead our analytics program, defining reporting frameworks that capture key business outcomes and driving optimization efforts.  You will be responsible for developing the tracking infrastructure and creating data-informed narratives that address real-world business opportunities and challenges. Reporting to the VP, Business Intelligence, your role will involve elevating and optimizing current reporting programs, processes, and outputs, as well as finding innovative ways to support clients with a data-driven focus in collaboration with the corporate analytics

Your Responsibilities:

  • Drive Spring & Bond’s reporting and analytics program

  • Serve as the liaison to the VP, Business Intelligence, and collaborate closely with the data engineering team, strategy team, and cross-office peers to enhance Spring & Bond’s data initiatives, analytics programs, and practices

  • Lead cross-functional projects using data modeling and analysis techniques to uncover insights that guide strategic decisions

  • Examine, interpret, and communicate the results and business impact of analytical initiatives to key internal stakeholders and client teams

  • Support omnichannel initiatives and coordinate with marketing technology on methodology and execution of customer campaigns

  • Develop and own analysis approaches for engagement activities, targeting analysis, reporting, and ad hoc requests with a focus on omnichannel

  • Expertise with Tableau and programming languages like SQL

  • Familiarity with syndicated data sources (e.g., IQVIA, claims data, etc.)

  • Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations

title: Direct Response Copywriter
description:
Title:  Direct Response Copywriter

Location: UK Remote (With monthly travel to our central London Office)

Position: Perm

About PetLab Co

PetLab Co is the world leader in the DTC pet supplement market with 50%+ market share, 9-figure revenue, profitable and rapidly growing with ambitious plans for expansion. We’re searching for a results-driven direct response copywriter to join our team and help us scale to new heights.  

You’ll take full ownership of a key SKU, driving its revenue growth through innovative testing and optimization. Working closely with our video editing and media buying teams, you’ll create, refine, and iterate on new short-form video ad creatives and funnels.

We rigorously test our short-form ads and optimize them based on data. It often takes multiple iterations before an ad truly hits its stride. Hence, you should be persistent, fascinated by consumer behaviour, and well-versed in conversion rate optimization. So, if you live and breathe persuasive copywriting, are excited about a new challenge in a unique market, have a knack for creating compelling problem/solution copy that gets results…

… then please keep reading as you may be the perfect fit.

Who Will You Report Into?

Hi, I’m Tom Kruszewski, Head of Copy at PetLab Co,  and I need your help. PetLab Co. was started in 2018 because we saw an unmet need to offer safe, effective nutritional supplements to help pets have their happiest, healthiest lives.  Since then, we’ve become the fastest-growing pet health brand in the U.S., thanks in part to our rigorous scientific approach to customer acquisition and conversion and our focus on building a robust subscription business.

We’ve become very good at ad creative, building an in-house video & copy creative team that delivers 1,100+ new customers a day on paid social platforms. This year, we will be expanding our product range and focus, which is where you come in.

We’re confident that with another talented direct response copywriter on the team, we can test and crack more angles faster, and significantly grow our customer acquisition volume. Your work will be front and centre across our platforms, fuelling our growth while helping us stay true to our mission of creating happier, healthier lives for pets everywhere.

 

What’s the Ideal Candidate’s Background?

The ideal candidate is a direct response copywriter who can seamlessly shift between punchy, high-impact short-form video scripts and longer-form presell advertorial copy. You love digging into data, analysing the results of each test, brainstorming new angles, and going back to the drawing board until you find “the one.” You’re a master at hooking attention quickly and know how to tell a gripping story in seconds.

More importantly, you’re addicted to consumer psychology, love designing experiments, have high empathy for consumers, and come alive at crafting strategy. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, love rolling up your sleeves to produce copy at scale, and know how to speak directly to our target customers’ deepest desires and pain points.

You’ll flourish in a team environment with other high-caliber creatives, sharing insights, brainstorming fresh hypotheses, and collaborating to continuously refine our approach. Ultimately, you’re laser-focused on discovering the type of messaging that resonates so powerfully, viewers can’t help but click.

 

What’s It Like Working at PetLab Co.?

We’ve gone to great lengths to set up a data-driven culture wherein the best ideas win, regardless of where they come from.  As a rapidly growing company, we prioritize finding people who can think fast, move fast and deliver fast… while having fun at the same time.

To that end, here’s what you’ll get access to when you join our team:

  • Clear Reporting – Getting accurate and timely data is crucial to enabling marketers to do their jobs, which is precisely what our standalone data analytics team delivers
  • Collaborative Team – There are no silos here, we all understand that to win, we must help each other out as necessary, doing things outside our normal jobs when needed
  • Scientific Rigor – Everyone on the marketing team shares the same philosophy to attack every challenge with an experimental test-and-learn process to tease out success
  • Variety of Challenges – Given we’re just entering our 5th year as a company and growing rapidly, the challenges keep coming with new products, promotions, categories, etc.
  • Refreshing Autonomy – Expectations are always set high for anybody who joins the team, but so too is your autonomy to figure out how best to deliver against your objectives

You’ll also find that everyone here listens – if something isn’t working, we respectfully call it out.  If something is needed, those needs are heard.  If there’s something we can do better, let’s hear it.

Requirements

  • 3-5 Years Direct Response Copywriting – Hands-on creation of high-performing short-form video ad scripts and presell advertorials for paid social in a fast-paced environment.
  • Consumer-Oriented – Strong empathy for consumers, deep understanding of psychology, and excellent research skills to identify those big-idea concepts that capture attention fast.
  • Data-Driven – Extremely comfortable flexing your analytical side, dissecting performance metrics, and iterating fast to improve conversions.
  • Systems-Oriented – Highly organized with repeatable processes that help you efficiently launch multiple concepts at once.
  • Exceptional Communication – Able to quickly synthesize info and articulate clear strategies, verbally and in writing, for your creative team.
  • Proven Success – Demonstrable, measurable success in scaling short-form direct response campaigns – whether for in-house brands or agency clients.
  • Direct Response Marketer – You know how to pinpoint an opportunity, devise a strategy, build a plan, and deliver success. You understand the interplay between problem, solution, and the unique mechanism that makes a product stand out.
  • Robust Test Architect – Capable of defining test parameters (audience, sample size, and creative variable) and executing them systematically until you find the winning formula.
  • Think Fast, Move Fast – Energized by a high-velocity, high-growth entrepreneurial environment with loads of new angles and campaigns to test.
  • Driven to Excellence – Possess a relentless inner drive to deliver excellence in every project, from concept to final cut.

Benefits

The Good Stuff…

  • Generous Annual Leave - 28 days + public and bank holidays
  • Bonus- based on performance and paid out April and October
  • Flexible Working Hours – We focus on results and trust people to manage their time, whether working from home, while traveling, or in the office!
  • Company Equipment – Laptop issued to you so you're all set from day 1.
  • Get Your Read On – We love to promote and encourage personal & professional development so we couldn't be happier to buy books of your choice via amazon or pay for audible subscription.
  • Employee Assistance Programme.
  • Pension Scheme – contributions towards your pension scheme!
  • Enhanced Maternity / Paternity / Adoption Leave – because time with new family members is important!
  • Puppy Therapy – working in partnership with Paws in Work to provide a boost of oxytocin every quarter.
  • Cycle2Work Scheme – Government initiative which offers a cost-effective way to buy new cycling equipment.
  • Discount Vouchers & Gym Memberships – get discounts at a whole range of retailers and gym memberships through our provider, Sodexo.
  • Free breakfast, fruits and snacks – refuel and revitalise with free munchies in the office.
  • Environment – dogs are welcome!

We encourage all applications irrespective of gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, nationality, marital status, and disability. We believe that diversity is at the heart of innovation and we welcome passionate candidates form all backgrounds. Come join the family and see for yourself!



About the company

Petlab Co. is the world’s fastest-growing pet supplement business. Launching in December 2018,PetLab Co. has a loyal community of over 100,000+ pets and owners, who have had their lives positively impacted by innovative Petlab Co. products. Petlab Co. is a vibrant, fast-moving, and customer-centric team who value and reward high-performing players. It is an ideal place for a candidate who is ambitious, hardworking, loves animals, is looking to rapidly progress their career, and would enjoy working in a vibrant environment with smart co-workers and friendly office dogs! With a currently strong foothold in the United States, in the next several years, the Company intends to rapidly establish a presence across Europe and Asia. This exciting growth/hyper-scale will be underpinned by a continually evolving bedrock of proprietary product formulations that will improve pet and owner lives. As our first Recruiter you will partner closely with our founders and company leaders to expand our excellent engineering, sales, and operations teams, as well as help us build out newer functions like product and marketing.

You'll need experience in the entire recruiting cycle - from sourcing to closing candidates - and will need the ability to spot talented individuals at various levels of career experience from all types of backgrounds.

You'll be the cornerstone of our recruiting team and will also have significant input into how we build our recruiting process and culture as we scale from dozens to hundreds of employees across the country over the coming years.

WHAT YOU WILL DO 👷‍♀️

  • Assist our Founders and leadership team in scaling our best in class team to better serve our customers.

  • Spend your days sourcing, contacting, and closing top tier talent across the US and around the world.

  • Ensure candidates understand what AirGarage is and how we have a unique opportunity as a technology company that interacts with the physical world to impact people's daily lives.

  • Own our recruiting process from end to end in the early days and help us build out a people team as we scale and our hiring needs increase.

  • Bring in candidates from a wide variety of sources and guide them through the stages of our hiring pipeline toward close.

  • Support with non-recruiting people related functions such as compensation planning, annual reviews, healthcare, and more.

WHAT YOU NEED 👩🏼‍🎓

  • 3+ years of full cycle recruiting experience at an agency / staffing firm or at a fast growing start up.

  • You're excited to build a talent function from the ground up (with the potential opportunity lead it down the line if you excel and grow in the role).

  • You're experienced in and comfortable with handling the entire recruiting cycle, from sourcing to coordinating to helping close candidates.

  • You find creative ways to to connect with talent and get a thrill from the daily hunt of sourcing hidden talent.

  • You can partner with the leadership team to translate business needs into hiring goals.

  • You pay attention to detail. You take pride in a clean recruiting pipeline. You obsess over staying on top of all candidates in process.

  • You move fast. You constantly find areas of improvement. You know how to use tools & technology to leverage your time and you know which tools are best for an early to mid stage company's needs.

  • You are analytical and use numbers to track progress and identify issues.

  • You have a passion for cultivating an exceptional candidate experience.

  • You have an ability to discern a candidate's true talent and ability beyond just resume and title matching.

  • You have experience closing senior candidates across go-to-market, product & engineering roles.

  • You can tell AirGarage's story in way that resonates with candidates.

🚨 WHY THIS ROLE MAY NOT BE FOR YOU 🚨

Please review this section before applying. We are sharing this information up front because we don’t expect this job to be appealing to everybody and we do not want to waste your time if you are not on board with all of the following.

Being the first recruiting hire at a high growth startup means many different things, but there is one thing above all that it certainly means: hiring success or failure is ultimately your responsibility.

This will be a hard job. We work long hours at AirGarage, including nights and weekends when necessary, because we love what we do. You will be expected to do the same. We are growing fast but our hiring team is lean, so every day you will have new challenges and too much on your plate, but you’ll be expected to find a way to deliver anyways.

Below are some of the reasons you might not want this job:

  • You are not excited about being the first (and only, for the time being) recruiting / people team member at an early stage company. You should not take this role if you are not comfortable defining your own process and expect to have a playbook handed to you, because there is no playbook in place today.

  • You don’t want to be involved in the weeds on every hire, partnering closely with hiring managers to run the entire hiring process from beginning to end, including the nitty gritty tactical work of sourcing, scheduling interviews, creating offers, and everything else involved in running a successful hiring process.

  • You don’t wake up every day feel energized to source the next great team member that will come to work at AirGarage. Hiring is an extremely rewarding treasure hunt of sorts, and if that isn’t what you live and breathe for and derive immense personal satisfaction from then you likely won’t feel fulfilled in this role.

  • You aren’t comfortable handling people / HR tasks outside of simply recruiting on an as needed basis. We don’t currently have a dedicated people team so compensation planning, end of year reviews, healthcare, 401k, and more fall on to the plates of our Founders and leadership team currently. We’re ideally looking for someone that is comfortable flexible beyond recruiting (which will absolutely be your top priority and focus in this role) to make sure all of these other people related things are taken care of so we maintain a high level of satisfaction among our current team members.

We understand that there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. We're looking for someone passionate, with grit and determination, who is excited to face the challenges of a rapidly growing startup. AirGarage is the type of company where you can grow exponentially, and we encourage you to apply to us even if you don't 100% match the candidate description.

title: Manager of Payor Contracting
description:

At  SonderMind,  we  know  that  therapy  works.  SonderMind  provides  accessible, personalized  mental healthcare that produces high-quality outcomes for patients. SonderMind's individualized approach to care starts with using innovative technology to help people not just ﬁnd a therapist, but ﬁnd the right, in-network therapist for them, should they choose to use their insurance. About the Role

As a dynamic and relationship-driven manager, you will develop, strengthen, and enhance SonderMind’s payor relationships nationwide, within an assigned region.  Using your commercial and government payor relationships and your broad knowledge of payor contracting, you will lead negotiations with payors and health plans, resulting in favorable reimbursement and contractual language terms.  You will proactively develop contract negotiation strategies that align with the financial objectives of SonderMind. You are a creative problem-solver and out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about improving access and outcomes in mental health.  

Essential Functions
  • Strategically determine where SonderMind could strengthen its in-network participation with payors and engage with new payors to secure in-network agreements. 
  • Develop and analyze complex data sets for use with rate modeling, proposal preparation, and negotiations.
